data.title: A good time
data.text: This is a cool bar to go to. There were a lot of students there so if that's not your scene, I would stay away. The beers are at a good price but the mixed drinks were pretty weak and I was disappointing in that. The music was a nice mix of genre's so that's always good!

data.title: Good fun and drinks and great food.
data.text: It's a pub, so there's likely to be a local drunkard or two (in our experience about four).  BUT the food, atmosphere and music (both live and jukebox) all make up for it.  Be sure to ask for whatever specials there are that day, because the chef is REALLY cool and creative.    We tried the ceviche of the day and it was good.  The ruben was FABULOUS (probably in the top three I've ever had), and the roasted Cesar salad (yes roasted salad) was amazing.    Fun bistro/pub/social atmosphere.  Don't expect a fine dining setting, but the food is fine!  Also be sure to try the LOCAL hot sauce and beers they have.  Great stuff!

data.title: Cool looking bar
data.text: Very cool interior to hang out in. Most mixed drinks were very good, a few were weakly mixed. Overall a good stop.

data.title: Local Hot Spot
data.text: Decent priced beverages. TVs all around. Friendly staff. Good music. Nothing too fancy but  better than your average dive bar.

data.title: Great food
data.text:
Meet Rick, he's a one man show during off hours and also one of the best chef's we've come across. Chile roasted pork skewers w/bok choi, duck confit and fish and chips, AMAZING! The best fish and chips we've ever had, his Italian grandmother's recipe. Rick is a trained chef and has been in numerous countries, he's a free spirit with dreads to his butt and truly amazing taste in shirts.
 We love Rick, what a great stop.

data.title: Great atmosphere, food and friendly, professional staff
data.text: The setting is unique - it was a 19th century boiler room that used to heat the adjoining office buildings.  The main bar is on the street level and the downstairs is two flights down with its own bar, pool table, game room and private, recessed seating areas, each with its own television. There is an enormous projection television screen that can be seen from both levels. When the weather is accommodating, the patio area in front of the main entrance is beautiful and features live entertainment.  The food I've had there is delicious and different than in many other restaurants due to the talented master chef.  Great place for business lunch, date night and can be reserved for large parties.

data.title: Awesome food, great bartenders, cool ambiance
data.text: Twist never disappoints. Amazing food. Hint: order your wings naked with sauce on the side. Bartenders are all welcoming and right there when you need them. The location and interior a super cool ambiance. The downstairs bar has a pool table, a pinball room, and a couple of crazy awesome side rooms, all under old steam vents. My new favorite SLC haunt when I'm in town.

data.title: Enjoyable Night
data.text:
We are Aussies and my two friends only had Australian drivers licenses and not their passports for ID. Given we are all over 60 and qualified for aged discount on the slopes we gently resisted being refused entry.  The doorman had to retreat inside and consult a person who I suspect is the owner who allowed us entry. A similar problem to the review below. 
The beer was good and the male guitarist and female singer providing entertainment were sensational. 
The food was the poor cousin of the evening. Only OK.

data.title: Uneducated staff
data.text: Had a reservation to this place but the "bouncer" wouldn't let us in. After giving the ladies in front of us a hard time about their bags.  He proceeded to tell us we were not allowed in because we were from Canada.  He said our drivers license were invalid because they were from Canada. We decided to research his ruling of our invalid license and we were told by state authorities that our drivers license are valid as identification.  If the staff member had of scanned them he would have discovered he was wrong and we would have been admitted. Kind of glad we were not allowed in anyway as the place was empty and didn't look like much fun. We come to Salt Lake twice per year for a trade-show and we wont be back to this place ever again.

data.title: Good drinks, great service - eh on the food
data.text: We go here often since it's within walking distance of our office. It's in a really cool building and they have great booths if you can snag one. Otherwise, you get to sit on uncomfortable wood chairs - typical of city restaurants. There's an area downstairs where you can shoot pool and watch TV. Good variety of drinks, just wish the food was better. You can't beat the price, which means you get what you pay for. I've had the pretzels and the burger and they're good. Onion rings - good. Fish and chips - awful. Nachos - awful. Don't think I'd be brave enough to order the oysters. The service saves this place. Very nice place to go to socialize.

data.title: New addition to SLC
data.text: Recently opened this summer. Nice patio for lunch and dinner. Beautiful space inside. Main floor has an awesome skylight. Downstairs has a bar, pool table, and pin-ball machines. Super busy on the weekend. Get there early if you want to grab a seat.

data.title: Great Patio
data.text: Brand new bar in SLC. A few veterans in the bar industry wanted to do their own thing, Twist is the culmination. The interior is an old steam heating furnace that used to supply heat to the surrounding blocks.  On the outside you have a large smoking friendly patio with excellent views of the local high-rises.

data.title: Stumbled on this new place for a business lunch
data.text:
Overall very promising. We chose to sit outside on the nice patio. The food selection is broad enough to cover many palettes (and requirements) without creating worry that they're trying too hard to please everyone.

I had the Club Sandwich and it was quite good. Try it on the tortilla wrap for a nice treat. The nachos were "okay" but not a feature -- I won't order them again. My buddies said the burger was "Good for people who like a complex burger." 

I'm going to swing by again this week for dinner and drink.
